intro: Psiguria warscewiczii, commonly known as the Warshawicz's psiguria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and prefers well-drained soil. Its botanical features include hairy stems and capsules as its fruiting structures. Psiguria warscewiczii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
